results.title: Rocking the foundations
results.creator_credit: Pat Fiske, Australian Film Commission. Creative Development Branch and Bower Bird Films
results.brief_description: A film that goes behind the headlines to look at the extraordinary chain of events that has made the New South Wales Builders’ Labourers’ Federation the controversial part of Australian history that it is today. It is a story about workers who began to act for themselves and make decisions about issues that affected ordinary people. Also looks at the new policies that saw women introduced into the building industry, limited tenure of office and the use of union power to assist resident action and environmental groups. Narrated by Pat Fiske. (NOTE: 16mm print is black and white.)
results.creator_credit_for_label: Pat Fiske, Australian Film Commission. Creative Development Branch and Bower Bird Films

results.title: Las Madres de Plaza de Mayo
results.brief_description: A compelling documentary account of the protests organised by the mothers of 30,000 people who disappeared in Argentina during the wave of kidnapping, tortures and murders initiated by the military junta during the 1970s. Winner of 17 International Awards.

results.title: Half life
results.creator_credit: Dennis O'Rourke and O'Rourke and Associates Filmakers
results.brief_description: This feature-length masterpiece reveals the effects of US nuclear tests on the lives of the inhabitants of the Marshall Islands in the Pacific Ocean. The film combines recently declassified US Defence Department footage on the Bravo Test of 1954 with interviews with the people of Rongelap who were not evacuated. Contains black & white footage.

results.title: Silent pioneers
results.brief_description: Through intimate profiles eight men and women, this film offers a portrait of the 3.5 million gay and lesbian elders in the USA. Contrary to the public stereotype of a youthful homosexual community, gay men and lesbians do grow old. This is a portrait of strong and active women and men who face not only issues of ageing, but also concerns related to sexual orientation. This film intimately profiles eight men and women

results.title: The Reef
results.brief_description: This exhilarating documentary presents Australia’s Great Barrier Reef from an historical perspective, with breathtaking photography of all its wonders. Introduced by the Duke of Edinburgh.

results.title: Just Australian trains
results.brief_description: A compilation of seven films featuring the trains of Australia - from our past to present day. This will appeal to the railway enthusiasts, and to those who aren’t railway buffs it may explain some of the railway’s history and mystique.
results.description: A compilation of seven films featuring the trains of Australia - from our past to present day. This will appeal to the railway enthusiasts, and to those who aren’t railway buffs it may explain some of the railway’s history and mystique.

results.title: The Icecream treaty
results.brief_description: The Antarctic Treaty’s aim is to protect the frozen continent whilst allowing peaceful scientific research. Due to renegotiation in 1991, the seven claimants face increasing pressure from a world hungry for the Antarctic’s riches. This video looks at how the people from many countries working there survive in the harsh but stunning surroundings.

results.title: Death and destiny: a Journey into Ancient Egypt
results.brief_description: At Saqqara, just south of the Great Pyramids, lies what is arguably the most important archaeological site in Egypt. At this site, the careful excavation work and detective cunning of an Australian archaeologist has uncovered clues to the assassination of a Pharaoh; a plot that involved court officials, the Pharaoh’s bodyguard and harem. Narrated by Phillip Adams.

results.title: From Opera with Love
results.brief_description: This lively production dispels many widely held misconceptions about opera and shows that it can be as entertaining and exciting as a football match or a bullfight. Excerpts that are featured in this program are from, “the Pirates of Penzance”, “The Magic Flute”, “Carmen”, “Cosi fan tutte” and “The Barber of Seville”. Featuring Graham Blundell and Suzanne Johnston.
